16.heading: Blimp, Avery.
16.title: "Getting Along Without a Maid"
16.author: King.
notes: Summary: Avery listens to his wife's reasoning that, since she's saving so much money by not having a maid, she should be able to afford an oriental rug, an overstuffed chair and some new table linen. He responds that not having a chauffeur or a valet should entitle him to a yacht.

27.heading: Blimps.
27.title: "Death Rides the Big Balloons!"
27.author: Bill Mantlo, writer ; Frank Robbins, penciler ; Steve Leialoha, inker ; Rick Parker, letterer ; Don Warfield, colorist
27.appears_in: 17 p. in The Human Fly, no. 14 (Oct. 1978).
notes: Summary: A lighter-than-air race begins, that includes a reconstructed Graf Zeppelin and Hindenberg. The race is a benefit for the "Fund for the Handicapped." The Human Fly plans to walk a tightrope between two blimps, but has an accident and one of the dirigibles approaches the Empire State Building at high speed. While the skyscraper is being evacuated, the Human Fly makes it to the runaway with Blaze's help, and finds two stowaway children. The kids can't speak but communicate in sign language, which luckily the Human Fly understands. The ship is diverted.
Cover title: "Fear Over Fifth Avenue!"

81.heading: Blind People.
81.title: Daredevil [videorecording]
81.author: Twentieth Century Fox and Regency Enterprises present in association with Marvel Enterprises, Inc
81.appears_in: a New Regency/Horseshoe Bay production ; producers, Arnon Milchan, Gary Foster, Avi Arad ; screenplay writer, Mark Steven Johnson ; director, Mark Steven Johnson.
notes: 1 videocassette (103 min.) : sd., col. ; 1/2 in.
VHS.

Summary: "By day, blind attorney Matt Murdock toils for justice in Hell's Kitchen. By night, he's Daredevil, The Man Without Fear, a powerful masked vigilante stalking the dark streets with an uncanny radar sense that allows him to "see" with superhuman capabilities. When the love of his life, the fiery Elektra Natchios, is targeted by New York City's ruthless Kingpin of Crime and his deadly assassin, Bullseye, Daredevil may be about to meet his match."
Superhero films.

265.heading: Blizzards.
265.title: "Get Some Snow Tires, You Big Baby"
265.author: Scott Adams.
notes: Summary: Dilbert suggests closing the office because the forecast says "blizzards, freezing rain, tsunamis, deadly lava flows, and precision-guided ball lightning. And radiation-enlarged swarms of killer bees."

266.heading: Blizzards.
266.title: "Mamma, Is It Warm Where We're Going?"
266.author: Ole May in Cleveland Leader
266.appears_in: p. 96 in Cartoons Magazine, v. 5, no. 1 (Jan. 1914).
notes: Shows a mother and three children in a blizzard.

267.heading: Blizzards.
267.title: "Never Choose Today's Wardrobe Based on Last Night's Weather Forecast"
267.author: by Larry Wright.
notes: Summary: Kit is in shorts with her golf bag, looking out at a blizzard.

268.heading: Blizzards.
268.title: "Then You Won't Mind This Little Blizzard"
268.author: [No author]
268.series: Our Boarding House with Major Hoople, Dec. 28, 1956
notes: Summary: The Major talks about swimming in Hudson Bay with pneumonia to rescue Eskimo fishermen.

269.heading: Blizzards.
269.title: "Where Men are Men"
269.author: J
notes: Summary: One of the men has come over from the bunkhouse in a blizzard in his longjohns, to ask Cooky what to do for a bad cold.

270.heading: Blizzards.
270.title: "The World is Full of Wimps"
270.author: by Mort Walker
270.appears_in: reproduced on p. 172 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: General Halftrack is trying to find someone to play golf with in a blizzard.

271.heading: Blizzerbund Software.
271.title: "Who the Heck is Blizzerbund Software?"
271.author: by Bill Amend.
notes: Summary: Paige gets an unexpected package in the mail.

272.title: Bligh, William, 1754-1817
notes: Ship captain. Bligh is also a character in the album Robinsonia, where he meets Daniel Defoe.
